original: rdo rje srung ba gser gyi mdog can phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje go cha bsnams te /
analyzed: rdo rje srung ba gser gyi mdog can phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje go cha bsnams te /
translated: Vajravarada is golden in color and holds a vajra and bell in his two hands.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la go bskon pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la go bskon pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa'o //
translated: He is in the form of donning armor for all the tathagatas.

original: rdo rje gnod sbyin sku mdog nag po lto ba yang pa /
analyzed: rdo rje gnod sbyin sku mdog nag po lto ba yang pa /
translated: Vajrayaksha is black and pot-bellied.

original: zhal gyi mche ba gtsigs pa rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis zhal gyi mtha' gnyis su mche ba gnyis 'dzin cing bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhal gyi mche ba gtsigs pa rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis zhal gyi mtha' gnyis su mche ba gnyis 'dzin cing bzhugs pa'o //
translated: His fangs are bared, and he stands with two vajra fists holding two fangs at the two corners of his mouth.

original: rdo rje khu tshur sku mdog ser po dam tshig gi khu tshur gnyis kyi nang du rdo rje chud pa /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur sku mdog ser po dam tshig gi khu tshur gnyis kyi nang du rdo rje chud pa /
translated: Vajramuṣṭi is yellow, with two pledge fists containing vajras.

original: dam tshig gi khu @114b tshur gyis btsir zhing bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi khu @114b tshur gyis btsir zhing bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He stands pressing with the pledge fists.

original: sgeg mo sku mdog dkar pa /
analyzed: sgeg mo sku mdog dkar pa /
translated: Lāsyā is white,

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis rdo rje rtse lnga pa gnyis bsnams te /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis rdo rje rtse lnga pa gnyis bsnams te /

original: rdo rje 'gying ba'i tshul gyis sgeg pas g-yon du cung zad 'dud pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'gying ba'i tshul gyis sgeg pas g-yon du cung zad 'dud pa'o //
translated: She is charming with the manner of a vajra dance, bowing slightly to the left.

original: phreng ba ma sku mdog ser po /
analyzed: phreng ba ma sku mdog ser po /
translated: Mālā is yellow,

original: rin po che'i phreng bas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams tshem par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i phreng bas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams tshem par mdzad pa'o //

original: glu ma sku mdog dmar skya pi wang brdung ba'o //
analyzed: glu ma sku mdog dmar skya pi wang brdung ba'o //
translated: Gītā is pale red, playing a lute.

original: gar ma sku mdog rdo rje las lta bu rdo rje rtse gsum pa bsnams te /
analyzed: gar ma sku mdog rdo rje las lta bu rdo rje rtse gsum pa bsnams te /
translated: Nṛtyā is the color of vajra work, holding a three-pronged vajra.

original: phyag gnyis kyis gar mdzad cing ba zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis gar mdzad cing ba zhugs pa'o //
translated: She dances with two hands, standing in the middle of a blazing bonfire.

original: bdug pa ma sku mdog dkar mo rdo rje spos snod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams tshim par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bdug pa ma sku mdog dkar mo rdo rje spos snod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams tshim par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The white incense goddess satisfies the tathagatas with a vajra incense burner.

original: me tog ma sku mdog ser mo phyag g-yon gyis rdo rje me tog gi snod thogs te /
analyzed: me tog ma sku mdog ser mo phyag g-yon gyis rdo rje me tog gi snod thogs te /
translated: The yellow flower goddess holds a vajra flower vessel in her left hand

original: phyag g-yas kyis me tog gi char 'bebs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas kyis me tog gi char 'bebs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: and showers a rain of flowers with her right hand.

original: mar me ma sku mdog dmar skya mar me'i sdong bu bsnams te /
analyzed: mar me ma sku mdog dmar skya mar me'i sdong bu bsnams te /
translated: The pale red lamp goddess holds a lamp wick

original: snang ba'i tshogs kyis mchod par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i tshogs kyis mchod par mdzad pa'o //
translated: and makes offerings with a host of lights.

original: byug pa ma gar ma ltar sna tshogs pa'i mdog can phyag g-yon dri'i dung chos bsnams te /
analyzed: byug pa ma gar ma ltar sna tshogs pa'i mdog can phyag g-yon dri'i dung chos bsnams te /
translated: The variegated colored perfume goddess, like a dancer, holds a perfume conch in her left hand

original: phyag g-yas kyis dri'i sprin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod cing bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas kyis dri'i sprin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod cing bzhugs pa'o //
translated: and makes offerings to the tathagatas with a cloud of perfume with her right hand.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu sku mdog dkar po rdo rje lcags khus de bzhin gshegs pa rnams spyan 'dren par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu sku mdog dkar po rdo rje lcags khus de bzhin gshegs pa rnams spyan 'dren par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The white vajra hook goddess invites the tathagatas with a vajra hook.

original: rdo rje zhags pa sku mdog ser po rdo rje zhags pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gzhug par mdzad pa'o //🔽rdo rje lcags sgrog sku mdog dmar skya rdo rje lcags sgrog gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'ching bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhags pa sku mdog ser po rdo rje zhags pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gzhug par mdzad pa'o // rdo rje lcags sgrog sku mdog dmar skya rdo rje lcags sgrog gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'ching bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: Vajrapāśa is yellow in color and causes the tathāgatas to enter with a vajra noose.🔽Vajrasphoṭa is pale red in color and binds the tathāgatas with a vajra chain.

original: rdo rje 'bebs pa sna tshogs pa'i mdog can phyag g-yas kyis rdo rje dril bu bsnams te /
analyzed: rdo rje 'bebs pa sna tshogs pa'i mdog can phyag g-yas kyis rdo rje dril bu bsnams te /
translated: Vajrāveśa is multicolored and holds a vajra and bell in his right hand.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'bebs par mdzad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'bebs par mdzad pa /
translated: He causes the tathāgatas to descend.

original: phyag g-yon gdan la brten te bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon gdan la brten te bzhugs pa'o //
translated: His left hand rests on his seat.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni zhi ba'i nyams dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni zhi ba'i nyams dang ldan pa /
translated: The tathāgatas have a peaceful expression,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: are adorned with all ornaments,

original: zhi ba'i gzigs stangs dang / 'dzum pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i gzigs stangs dang / 'dzum pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: and have a peaceful gaze and a smile.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ni rab tu dgyes pas spyan gdangs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ni rab tu dgyes pas spyan gdangs pa /
translated: Vajrasattva and so forth have wide-open eyes out of intense joy,

original: sgeg pa'i nyams dang 'dzum pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sgeg pa'i nyams dang 'dzum pa dang bcas pa /
translated: have a playful expression and a smile,🔽and are adorned with all ornaments.

original: sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan dang dar dbyangs kyis dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan dang dar dbyangs kyis dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa /
translated: They are empowered with the diadems of the five Buddhas and with streamers of silk.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: They are adorned with all the ornaments.

original: byams pa la sogs pa shar gyi cha la ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra bar rdo rje bsnams @115a * //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa shar gyi cha la ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra bar rdo rje bsnams @115a * //
translated: Maitreya and so forth, in the eastern quarter, hold vajras like Vajrasattva.

original: pa'o ; / lhor ni rdo rje rin chen dang 'dra bar rin po che bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / lhor ni rdo rje rin chen dang 'dra bar rin po che bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the south, Ratnasambhava holds a jewel like Vajraratna.

original: nub tu ni rdo rje chos dang 'dra bar rdo rje padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: nub tu ni rdo rje chos dang 'dra bar rdo rje padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the west, Amitabha holds a lotus-vajra like Vajradharma.

original: byang du ni rdo rje las dang 'dra bar sna tshogs rdo rje bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: byang du ni rdo rje las dang 'dra bar sna tshogs rdo rje bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the north, Amoghasiddhi holds a crossed vajra like Vajrakarma.

original: khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference is this:

original: 'di ltar rin po che'i chod pan dang dar dpyangs kyi dbang bskur ba mnga' ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rin po che'i chod pan dang dar dpyangs kyi dbang bskur ba mnga' ba yin no //
translated: They are empowered with diadems of jewels and streamers of silk.

original: aom sarbba sam sk'a ra pa ri shuddha dharmm'a te ma h'a n'a ya ba ri b'a re sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni bskal pa bzang po rnams kyi spyi'i rig pa yin no //
analyzed: aom sarbba sam sk'a ra pa ri shuddha dharmm'a te ma h'a n'a ya ba ri b'a re sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni bskal pa bzang po rnams kyi spyi'i rig pa yin no //
translated: Oṃ sarva-saṃskāra-pariśuddha-dharmatā-te mahā-nayāvarāha-svāhā. This is the general vidyā of the good eons.

original: de nas rdo rje slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, the vajra master, etc.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor legs par bkod nas /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor legs par bkod nas /
translated: Thus, having arranged the mandala well,

original: phyi rol kun du spos chus byug cing me tog sil ma bkram la dgongs ka'i dus su /
analyzed: phyi rol kun du spos chus byug cing me tog sil ma bkram la dgongs ka'i dus su /
translated: outside, having anointed with scented water and strewn flower petals, at the time of the evening,

analyzed: badzra satva zhes zlos shing rdo rje sems dpa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya me tog gi phreng ba bzung la /
translated: recite vajrasattva, and holding the flower garland of the pledge seal of Vajrasattva,

original: rdo rje shugs kyi dkyil 'khor du zhugs la /
analyzed: rdo rje shugs kyi dkyil 'khor du zhugs la /
translated: enter into the mandala of the Vajra Speed.

original: yang rdo rje dril bu dkrol zhing dkyil 'khor lan bdun bskor ba byas la /
analyzed: yang rdo rje dril bu dkrol zhing dkyil 'khor lan bdun bskor ba byas la /
translated: Again, ringing the vajra and the bell, circumambulate the mandala seven times.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi lhag pa dang ma tshang ba'i nyes pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir bltas la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi lhag pa dang ma tshang ba'i nyes pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir bltas la /
translated: In order to pacify the faults of the excess and omissions of the entire mandala,

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la phreng ba de phul te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la phreng ba de phul te /
translated: having gazed at it, offer the garland to the Blessed One, Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje'i gar byas te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i gar byas te /
translated: Having performed the vajra dance,

original: blangs la rang gi mgo la bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: blangs la rang gi mgo la bcing bar bya'o //
translated: take it up and tie it on one's own head.

original: badzra satva h'um zhes bya ba bar ma chad par bzlas par bya'o ;
analyzed: badzra satva h'um zhes bya ba bar ma chad par bzlas par bya'o ;
translated: Recite vajrasattva hūṃ without interruption.

original: / de yang rdo rje dril bu rab bskor bas //
analyzed: / de yang rdo rje dril bu rab bskor bas //
translated: And by turning the vajra and bell,

original: mkhas pas ma tshang yongs su skong //
analyzed: mkhas pas ma tshang yongs su skong //
translated: the wise one should make up for any deficiencies.

original: lhag pa gang yin 'dor bar byed //
analyzed: lhag pa gang yin 'dor bar byed //
translated: Whatever is in excess should be removed.

original: 'grub 'gyur smad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'grub 'gyur smad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not disparage the accomplishment.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de'i rjes la yi ge h'um las bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la yi ge h'um las bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad du bsam par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should visualize oneself as Vajra Humkara arisen from the syllable hum.

original: de nas dbus su 'dug nas ni //
analyzed: de nas dbus su 'dug nas ni //
translated: Then, having sat down in the center,

original: rdo rje slob dpon mnyam gzhag pas //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon mnyam gzhag pas //
translated: the vajra master, with equipoise,

original: rdo rje sgo ni rnam bzhi po //🔽yid kyis su ni dbye bar bya //
analyzed: rdo rje sgo ni rnam bzhi po // yid kyis su ni dbye bar bya //
translated: mentally opens the four vajra doors.

original: aom badzro tgha ta sa ma ya bra be sha ya h'um zhes bya ba /
analyzed: aom badzro tgha ta sa ma ya bra be sha ya h'um zhes bya ba /
translated: Om vajrottama samaya praveśaya hum.

original: phyag rgya dang ldan pas dkyil 'khor gyi sgo thams cad dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang ldan pas dkyil 'khor gyi sgo thams cad dbye bar bya'o //
translated: Endowed with the mudra, one should open all the doors of the mandala.

original: de nas rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas nas /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas nas /
translated: Then, having performed the great yoga endowed with the practice of Vajrasattva,

original: rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la /
translated: in the victorious vase endowed with the characteristics as explained,

original: rdo rje dang bcas pa'i me tog gi lcug ma rdo rje sems mas yongs su bzung ba las /
analyzed: rdo rje dang bcas pa'i me tog gi lcug ma rdo rje sems mas yongs su bzung ba las /
translated: From a flower branch with a vajra held by Vajrasattva,

original: aom badzra satva h'um zhes bya ba 'di lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la /
analyzed: aom badzra satva h'um zhes bya ba 'di lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la /
translated: one should recite this mantra, Oṃ vajrasattva hūṃ, one hundred and eight times.

original: yang badzrod ka h'um zhes stong rtsa brgyad mngon par @115b bzlas te /
analyzed: yang badzrod ka h'um zhes stong rtsa brgyad mngon par @115b bzlas te /
translated: Again, one should recite the mantra of the vajra hook, Oṃ vajra aṅkuśa hūṃ, one thousand and eight times.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i spyan sngar legs par gzhag go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i spyan sngar legs par gzhag go //
translated: One should place it well in front of the Blessed Vajrasattva.

original: bum pa lhag ma rnams la ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te /
analyzed: bum pa lhag ma rnams la ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te /
translated: In the remaining vases, one should recite the mantra of the Tathāgata, etc., one hundred and eight times,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: and place them outside the maṇḍala.

original: de'i rjes la bum pa gang ba la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sngags bzlas la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la bum pa gang ba la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sngags bzlas la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should place the filled vases, reciting the mantra of Vairocana, etc.

original: yang bum pa gcig la rdo rje sems dpa' lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzla ste 'jug pa'i sgor mngon par phyogs par gzhag go //
analyzed: yang bum pa gcig la rdo rje sems dpa' lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzla ste 'jug pa'i sgor mngon par phyogs par gzhag go //
translated: Again, in one vase, one should recite the mantra of Vajrasattva one hundred and eight times, and place it facing the entrance.

original: ma 'byor na dpal rdo rje sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la bum pa dul bar bya ste /
analyzed: ma 'byor na dpal rdo rje sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la bum pa dul bar bya ste /
translated: If one does not have them, one should purify the vases of glorious Vajrasattva and the five Tathagatas.

original: aom badzra satva mu shti aa: zhes bya ba ni bskyod pa'i rigs kyi bum pa la'o //
analyzed: aom badzra satva mu shti aa: zhes bya ba ni bskyod pa'i rigs kyi bum pa la'o //
translated: Om vajra-sattva-mushti a is for the vase of the Vajra family.

original: aom badzra ratna mu shti tr'am zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs kyi bum pa la'o //
analyzed: aom badzra ratna mu shti tr'am zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs kyi bum pa la'o //
translated: Om vajra-ratna-mushti tram is for the vase of the Ratna family.

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams bsgrub pa ni phyag rgya bzhir bstan pa nyid ni dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya zhes bya'o zhes rgyud gzhan las gsungs pas na dam tshig dang / chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po'i tshul nyid las rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas de'i phyir dam tshig rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The way of the pledge, doctrine, action, and great seal is not to be transgressed by the Tathagatas such as Vairochana, and therefore they are called pledges.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /

original: dam tshig dang / chos dang / las dang / phyag rgya chen po nyid kyis de rnams gzhag par bya'o //🔽dkyil 'khor du bris pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku la /
analyzed: dam tshig dang / chos dang / las dang / phyag rgya chen po nyid kyis de rnams gzhag par bya'o // dkyil 'khor du bris pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku la /

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ye shes sems dpa' rnams kyi chos dang / las dang / phyag rgya chen po'i tshul rab tu gnas par bya ba ni gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ye shes sems dpa' rnams kyi chos dang / las dang / phyag rgya chen po'i tshul rab tu gnas par bya ba ni gzhag pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the gnosis beings of Vairochana and so forth in the body of Vairochana and so forth drawn in the mandala is the establishment of the way of the doctrine, action, and great seal of the gnosis beings of Vairochana and so forth in the body of Vairochana and so forth drawn in the mandala.

original: dam tshig mchog gi phyag rgya dang // sems dpa'i rdo rje la sogs pas //
analyzed: dam tshig mchog gi phyag rgya dang // sems dpa'i rdo rje la sogs pas //

original: de ltar sems dpa' chen po bsgrub //
analyzed: de ltar sems dpa' chen po bsgrub //

analyzed: sems ma rdo rje ma la sogs pa byed pa por gyur pa rnams kyang bsgrub par bya zhing bdag nyid dbang du bya'o //

original: ci smra zhing zhe na /
analyzed: ci smra zhing zhe na /

original: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod cing zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod cing zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: aa: zhes bya ba dbab pa'i snying po yin pa'i phyir dang / ho zhes bya ba rdo rje chags pa'i snying po yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis don 'di bshad par mdzad pa yin te /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos dang las dang / phyag rgya chen pos gzhag par bya'o //

analyzed: bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpar bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: yang rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te /

analyzed: de nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya de nyid dang / sa ma ya stam zhes brjod pas /

analyzed: rgyab tu zla ba grub nas ni //
translated: The moon is accomplished behind.

analyzed: sa ma ya stvam aa ham zhes brjod do //

analyzed: der bdag sems dpa'i lus su bsgom /
translated: One should meditate on oneself as the body of the sattva.

translated: This is the procedure for binding all the seals, elucidating reality, which is stated in the Tantra of the Extensive Ritual for Attaining the Sāṃvara of All Seals.

analyzed: de bas na dam tshig gi phyag rgyas lha rnams bsgrub par byas la /

analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas la sogs pa //

translated: in the doors,🔽the great beings, beginning with Vairocana,

original: bskal pa bzang po'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi sems dpa' chen po kun bsdus shing tshogs par mdzad par 'gyur ba rnams ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽spyan drangs nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi sems dpa' chen po kun bsdus shing tshogs par mdzad par 'gyur ba rnams ji lta bu yin zhe na / spyan drangs nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: up to the end of the Bhadrakalpa, are invited and assembled.

original: spyan drang pa ni rdo rje lcags kyus so //🔽rab tu gzhug pa ni zhags pas so //
analyzed: spyan drang pa ni rdo rje lcags kyus so // rab tu gzhug pa ni zhags pas so //
translated: Having invited them with the vajra hook,🔽having introduced them with the noose,

original: bcing ba ni lcags sgrog gis so //
analyzed: bcing ba ni lcags sgrog gis so //
translated: having bound them with the chain,🔽they come under one's control.

original: de'i dbang du gyur ces bya ba ni sgrub pa po de'i rdo rje 'bebs bas babs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i dbang du gyur ces bya ba ni sgrub pa po de'i rdo rje 'bebs bas babs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The practitioner, having been brought under control by the vajra-adhesion,

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rang dbang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rang dbang du gyur pa'o //
translated: Vairocana, etc., come under one's control.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na /
translated: Since that is so,

original: sgo rnams thams cad du /
analyzed: sgo rnams thams cad du /
translated: in all the doors,

original: lcags kyu la sogs pa'i las bgyis nas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu la sogs pa'i las bgyis nas zhes bya'o //
translated: Having performed the activities of the hook and so forth,

original: de nas badzra ratna zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: de nas badzra ratna zhes brjod cing /
translated: then say vajra ratna,🔽and with whatever is the pledge seal of the jewel vajra,

original: rdo rje rin chen dam tshig gi phyag rgya gang yin pa des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dbang bskur ba dang / byams pa la sogs pa yang de nyid @119a * //🔽kyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen dam tshig gi phyag rgya gang yin pa des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dbang bskur ba dang / byams pa la sogs pa yang de nyid @119a * // kyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: consecrate the Tathagatas, and also consecrate Maitreya and so forth with just that.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ni /
translated: Vajrasattva and so forth

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa sangs rgyas lnga'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa sangs rgyas lnga'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: are consecrated with the seals of the five Buddhas, such as Vajradhatviśvarī and so forth.

original: de nas rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad la mchod yon phul la /🔽ras zung 'bum mam ;🔽khri 'am / ras zung stong ngam /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad la mchod yon phul la / ras zung 'bum mam ; khri 'am / ras zung stong ngam /
translated: Then, having offered a welcoming water-offering to all the deities of the Vajrasattva mandala,🔽one hundred thousand pairs of garments,

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa re re zhing ras zung re 'am /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa re re zhing ras zung re 'am /
translated: or ten thousand pairs of garments, or one thousand pairs of garments,🔽or one pair of garments for each of Vairochana and so forth,

original: so sor ma 'byor na thams cad kyi spyir ras zung gcig dang / bla re rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / grva bzhir ba dan sna tshogs gdags pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rnams kyang rdo rje gnod sbyin dang /
analyzed: so sor ma 'byor na thams cad kyi spyir ras zung gcig dang / bla re rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / grva bzhir ba dan sna tshogs gdags pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rnams kyang rdo rje gnod sbyin dang /
translated: If you cannot afford all of these, then you should have at least one set of silk garments for all of them, a canopy of various forms, various banners placed in the four corners, parasols, victory banners, and flags.🔽

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang / yi ge aom lan bdun bzlas te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang / yi ge aom lan bdun bzlas te /
translated: If one does not have all of them, then one should have a single pair of cloths for all of them, and various canopies, and various banners placed in the four corners, and parasols, victory banners, and flags, all of which are consecrated with the mantra of Vajrāgrya, Vajrasattva, and the syllable OṂ, repeated seven times.

original: lha thams cad la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha thams cad la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer them to all the deities.

original: badzra spha ra na kham zhes bya bas me tog gi shing brgya brgya 'am /
analyzed: badzra spha ra na kham zhes bya bas me tog gi shing brgya brgya 'am /
translated: With the mantra “vajra-sphāraṇa khaṃ,” one should place one hundred trees of flowers,

original: me tog gi shing bzhi 'am /
analyzed: me tog gi shing bzhi 'am /
translated: or four trees of flowers,

original: me tog thams cad la yang /
analyzed: me tog thams cad la yang /
translated: or all the flowers,

original: rdo rje me dang / me tog gi rig pa mngon par bzlas nas /
analyzed: rdo rje me dang / me tog gi rig pa mngon par bzlas nas /
translated: consecrated with the awareness mantra of Vajra-fire and the awareness mantra of the flowers.

original: dri zhim po thams cad dang / kha la bsgo ba'i dri rnams yang rdo rje sems ma dang / dri'i rig pa dag bzlas pa dang / ga pur dang / aa ka ru dang tu ru ska dang tsandan la sogs pa dang bcas pa bdug spos kyi don du sbyar ba gtul ba'i spos snod 'bum mam /
analyzed: dri zhim po thams cad dang / kha la bsgo ba'i dri rnams yang rdo rje sems ma dang / dri'i rig pa dag bzlas pa dang / ga pur dang / aa ka ru dang tu ru ska dang tsandan la sogs pa dang bcas pa bdug spos kyi don du sbyar ba gtul ba'i spos snod 'bum mam /
translated: Having recited the awareness mantra of smell, together with camphor, agarwood, turushka, sandalwood, and so forth, one should offer to all the deities a hundred thousand,

original: khri 'am / spos snod stong ngam /
analyzed: khri 'am / spos snod stong ngam /
translated: ten thousand, a thousand,

original: brgya 'am / ma 'byor na spos snod bcu la /
analyzed: brgya 'am / ma 'byor na spos snod bcu la /
translated: a hundred, or if one cannot afford that, ten incense burners filled with incense.

original: rdo rje me dang / bdug pa'i rig pa mngon par bzlas te lha thams cad la dbul bar bya'o //🔽sva sti ka la sogs pa dang yon tan 'bum dang ldan pa shin tu legs par spyar ba'i kha zas bza' ba dang / bca' ba'i bye brag rnam pa sna tshogs pas gang ba'i snod 'bum ma /
analyzed: rdo rje me dang / bdug pa'i rig pa mngon par bzlas te lha thams cad la dbul bar bya'o // sva sti ka la sogs pa dang yon tan 'bum dang ldan pa shin tu legs par spyar ba'i kha zas bza' ba dang / bca' ba'i bye brag rnam pa sna tshogs pas gang ba'i snod 'bum ma /
translated: Having recited the vajra fire and incense awareness mantras, one should offer to all the deities a hundred thousand,

original: khri 'am / stong ngam /🔽brgya 'am / bcu la rdo rje me mang mngon par bzlas shin /
analyzed: khri 'am / stong ngam /🔽brgya 'am / bcu la rdo rje me mang mngon par bzlas shin /
translated: ten thousand, a thousand,🔽a hundred, or if one cannot afford that, ten vessels filled with food and drink.

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarbba dharmma'a na'm /
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarbba dharmma'a na'm /
translated: Reciting Om akaro mukha sarvadharma nama

original: a'a dya nu tpa nan t'a ta ces bya ba bzlas la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: a'a dya nu tpa nan t'a ta ces bya ba bzlas la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: adyanutpannatata, one should offer.

original: mar la sogs pa mar me grangs stong dam /
analyzed: mar la sogs pa mar me grangs stong dam /
translated: One should offer lamps of ghee, etc. , a thousand in number,

original: tha na snod chen po bzhi bltams pa la /
analyzed: tha na snod chen po bzhi bltams pa la /
translated: or, at the very least, four large vessels

original: rdo rje me dang / mar me'i rig pa bzlas pa dang / badzra spha ra na kham zhes zlos shing /
analyzed: rdo rje me dang / mar me'i rig pa bzlas pa dang / badzra spha ra na kham zhes zlos shing /
translated: with the vajra fire and lamp vidya-mantras, and reciting vajra spharana kham,

original: lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: one should offer to all the special deities.

original: rol mo'i cha byad stong ngam /
analyzed: rol mo'i cha byad stong ngam /
translated: One should offer a thousand musical instruments,

original: rol mo'i cha byad bcu la dpal 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i gzungs kyi skyil @119b 'khor las gsungs pa'i rol mo'i rig pa mngon par bzlas pa la /
analyzed: rol mo'i cha byad bcu la dpal 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i gzungs kyi skyil @119b 'khor las gsungs pa'i rol mo'i rig pa mngon par bzlas pa la /
translated: or ten musical instruments, with the musical instrument vidya-mantra taught in the Sri Triple World Conqueror Dharani Mandala,

original: badzra spha ra na kham zhes bya bas dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: badzra spha ra na kham zhes bya bas dbul bar bya'o //
translated: reciting vajra spharana kham.

original: gar mkhan dang rol mo la sogs pas mchod pa rnams kyang aom dang h'um mngon par bzlas la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gar mkhan dang rol mo la sogs pas mchod pa rnams kyang aom dang h'um mngon par bzlas la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should also offer the dance and music offerings, reciting om and hum.

original: gdu bu dang / rna cha dang / dbu rgyan dang / cod pan la sogs pa yang rdo rje rin chen gyi dar dpyangs dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gdu bu dang / rna cha dang / dbu rgyan dang / cod pan la sogs pa yang rdo rje rin chen gyi dar dpyangs dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should also offer jeweled banners of the vajra jewel to the bracelets, earrings, crowns, and diadems.

original: me tog gi chun 'phyang gis spras shing brgyan la /
analyzed: me tog gi chun 'phyang gis spras shing brgyan la /
translated: It is adorned with flower garlands and ornaments.

original: dra ba dang dra ba phyed pas brgyan pa dang / zla ba phyed pas nye bar mdzes par byas pa'i rta babs yid du 'ong ba dril bu la sogs pa dang bcas pa dang / rta dang / glang po che dang / ba lang gi khyu shin tu brtags pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: dra ba dang dra ba phyed pas brgyan pa dang / zla ba phyed pas nye bar mdzes par byas pa'i rta babs yid du 'ong ba dril bu la sogs pa dang bcas pa dang / rta dang / glang po che dang / ba lang gi khyu shin tu brtags pa rnams kyang /
translated: It is adorned with nets and half-nets, and beautified with half-moons, with beautiful arched gates together with bells, and with well-arranged herds of horses, elephants, and cows.

original: yi ge h'um dang / aom mngon par bzlas shing /
analyzed: yi ge h'um dang / aom mngon par bzlas shing /
translated: One should recite the syllables hūṃ and oṃ,

original: badzra sva ra na kham zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: badzra sva ra na kham zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: and vajra svāhā, and offer them to all the tathāgatas.

original: de nas mchod pa brgyad dang / las kyi dkyil 'khor gsungs pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gis yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: de nas mchod pa brgyad dang / las kyi dkyil 'khor gsungs pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gis yang dag par mchod la /
translated: Then, one should make offerings with the eight offerings and the sixteen offerings taught in the Action Tantra.

original: sgeg mo la sogs pa gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhis dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams mnyes par byas nas /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la slob dpon gyis dngos grub thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgeg mo la sogs pa gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhis dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams mnyes par byas nas / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la slob dpon gyis dngos grub thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Having pleased the deities of the maṇḍala with the four secret offerings such as the offering of dance,🔽the master should request all the tathāgatas

original: sems can gyi don mdzod cig ces gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mdzod cig ces gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: to perform the welfare of sentient beings in order to accomplish all powers.

original: de nas rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa'i chogs phyi rol du gtor ma sbyin no //
analyzed: de nas rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa'i chogs phyi rol du gtor ma sbyin no //
translated: Then, with the ritual taught in other tantras, one should give the outer bali.

original: de nas sbyin sreg gi cho gas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sngags kyis zhi ba'i sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad byas la /
analyzed: de nas sbyin sreg gi cho gas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sngags kyis zhi ba'i sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad byas la /
translated: Then, with the ritual of the fire sacrifice, one should perform the fire sacrifice of peace one hundred and eight times with the mantra of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: dpal rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i snying pos kyang sreg blugs bdun dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dpal rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i snying pos kyang sreg blugs bdun dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should also offer seven oblations with the essence mantras of glorious Vairocana and so forth.

original: de'i rjes la ji srid dkyil 'khor mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de'i rjes la ji srid dkyil 'khor mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa'am /
translated: After that, one should recite and meditate until one sees the maṇḍala directly,

original: sgra 'am gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thob par gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bzlas brjod dang bsgom pa bya'o //
analyzed: sgra 'am gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thob par gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bzlas brjod dang bsgom pa bya'o //
translated: or until one obtains the signs of sound, form, and so forth.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad du rdo rje slob dpon gyis de bzhin du las bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad du rdo rje slob dpon gyis de bzhin du las bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In all mandalas, the vajra master should perform the rite in this way.

original: dum bu bzhi pa las gsungs pa'i gzugs kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du /
analyzed: dum bu bzhi pa las gsungs pa'i gzugs kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du /
translated: In all mandalas, such as the mandala of form taught in the fourth section,🔽the vajra master is the vajra master who is characterized by the vajra,🔽whose nature is the yoga of all heroes.

original: sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnal 'byor gyi bdag nyid can gyi rdo rjes nye bar mtshon pa'i slob dpon ni rdo rje slob dpon te 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam du zad kyi /🔽rin chen padma'i @120a * //
analyzed: sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnal 'byor gyi bdag nyid can gyi rdo rjes nye bar mtshon pa'i slob dpon ni rdo rje slob dpon te 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam du zad kyi / rin chen padma'i @120a * //
translated: This is merely the meaning of the term characterized.

original: slob dpon la sogs pas kyang de bzhin du las bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slob dpon la sogs pas kyang de bzhin du las bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The master of the jewel, the master of the lotus, and so on, should also perform the rite in this way.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: Then, following that,

original: rdo rje sems dpas byin gyis brlabs pa'i slob ma ni rdo rje slob ma ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpas byin gyis brlabs pa'i slob ma ni rdo rje slob ma ste /
translated: the vajra disciple is the disciple who is empowered by Vajrasattva.

original: de rnams gzhug pa la sogs ba byas nas /
analyzed: de rnams gzhug pa la sogs ba byas nas /
translated: Having caused them to enter and so on,

original: dbab pa'i dam tshig la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa yin pas /
analyzed: dbab pa'i dam tshig la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa yin pas /
translated: the extensive rite of the pledge of descent and so on,🔽is the extensive rite of the pledge of descent and so on.

original: rdo rje slob ma'i dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje slob ma'i dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa ste /
translated: The extensive ritual for inducting the vajra disciple into the mandala, and so on.

original: de mchis so zhes bya ba ni rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de mchis so zhes bya ba ni rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: That exists means I will compose.

original: de la dang por ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dang por ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Among those, first means

original: de la gzhug pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi nang nas /
analyzed: de la gzhug pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi nang nas /
translated: among those, inducting and so on,

original: dang por re zhig gzhug par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dang por re zhig gzhug par bshad pa yin no //
translated: first, inducting is explained.

original: dgos pa ci zhig gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dgos pa ci zhig gi phyir zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa rnams na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa rnams na /
translated: In all worldly realms,

original: sems can khams lus pa med pa mi dge ba bcu las ldog par bya ba ni yongs su bskyab pa ste /
analyzed: sems can khams lus pa med pa mi dge ba bcu las ldog par bya ba ni yongs su bskyab pa ste /
translated: all sentient beings are to be protected from turning away from the ten nonvirtues.

original: des 'jig rten pa'i bde ba dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi mchog ste /
analyzed: des 'jig rten pa'i bde ba dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi mchog ste /
translated: By that, the supreme mundane bliss and supramundane siddhi

original: de nyid ni rgyu ste dgos pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid ni rgyu ste dgos pa yin la /
translated: is the cause, the purpose.

original: dgos pa de yongs su rdzogs pa ni 'bras bu yin pas na rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid de /
analyzed: dgos pa de yongs su rdzogs pa ni 'bras bu yin pas na rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid de /
translated: Since the completion of that purpose is the result, it is the cause and result.🔽

original: de'i slad du gang gi phyir dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir zhugs pa'i phyir dgos pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i slad du gang gi phyir dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir zhugs pa'i phyir dgos pa yod pa yin no //
translated: For that reason, because of entering this great mandala, there is a purpose.

original: gang gi phyir dgos pa yod pa de na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dgos pa yod pa de na /
translated: For what reason there is a purpose,

original: dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir bzhugs ba la snod du gyur pa dang / snod du ma gyur pa brtag mi 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir bzhugs ba la snod du gyur pa dang / snod du ma gyur pa brtag mi 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: in this great mandala, one should not investigate whether or not one is a suitable vessel.

original: 'di ni snod yin no //🔽'di ni snod ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di mi bgyi'o zhes rnal 'byor pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la zhu bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni snod yin no // 'di ni snod ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di mi bgyi'o zhes rnal 'byor pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la zhu bar bya ste /
translated: This is a suitable vessel.🔽This is not a suitable vessel.

original: ji ltar bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa de ltar 'dir ci'i phyir mi bya ba'i gtan tshigs ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa de ltar 'dir ci'i phyir mi bya ba'i gtan tshigs ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: The yogi/nī should request all the Tathāgatas, “Why is it that in this [tantra] one should not do as in the Action Tantra, etc.? What is the reason?”

original: 'dir rgyu ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, the reason is stated, “Why is that?”

original: sdig pa chen po bgyid ba yang mchis te zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa chen po bgyid ba yang mchis te zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: “There are also those who have committed great sins” means those who have committed the heinous crimes, etc.

original: zhugs te mthong na zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor mthong ba dang zhugs pa ni phyi dang gsang ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: zhugs te mthong na zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor mthong ba dang zhugs pa ni phyi dang gsang ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis yod do //
translated: Having entered and seen means that seeing and entering the mandala are of two types, by the distinctions of outer and inner.

original: phyi'i mthong ba ni rdo rje lcags kyu nas brtsams te lha thams cad kyi sku mthong ba ni phyi'i zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: phyi'i mthong ba ni rdo rje lcags kyu nas brtsams te lha thams cad kyi sku mthong ba ni phyi'i zhugs pa yin la /
translated: The outer seeing is the seeing of the body of all the deities beginning with the vajra hook, which is the outer entry.

original: sems ma rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du yid kyi ye shes babs pa ni gsang ba'i mthong ba dang zhugs pa yin @120b no ;
analyzed: sems ma rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du yid kyi ye shes babs pa ni gsang ba'i mthong ba dang zhugs pa yin @120b no ;
translated: The inner seeing and entry is the descent of the mental gnosis into the mandala of colored powder with the seal of Vajra Mind and so forth.

original: / ngan song thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang / dud 'gro zhes bya ba ni ngan song dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: / ngan song thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang / dud 'gro zhes bya ba ni ngan song dang bral ba ste /
translated: One will be free from all evil destinies means that one will be free from the evil destinies of hell beings, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: dkyil 'khor mthong ba dang zhugs pa dag gis ngan song thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor mthong ba dang zhugs pa dag gis ngan song thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: By seeing and entering the mandala, one will be free from all evil destinies.

original: de dag gang du 'gro ba'i las yongs su zad par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gang du 'gro ba'i las yongs su zad par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the karma that leads to those destinies is completely exhausted.

original: bcom ldan 'das nor dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nor dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The Blessed One, the second aspect of the cause is mentioned in the verse beginning with “wealth” and so on.

original: rgyu'i rnam pa gzhan gnyis pa smos pa yin te nor dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad la chags pa dang zhes bya ba ni nor kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas nor thams cad de ;
analyzed: rgyu'i rnam pa gzhan gnyis pa smos pa yin te nor dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad la chags pa dang zhes bya ba ni nor kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas nor thams cad de ;
translated: Wealth and all the objects of desire, such as food, drink, and the sense pleasures, are called “wealth” because they are both wealth and all.

original: rgyal srid kha zas ro brgya pa la sogs pa ni bza' ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal srid kha zas ro brgya pa la sogs pa ni bza' ba'o //
translated: The objects of desire are the objects of desire of the five senses, such as the kingdom, food with a hundred flavors, and so on.

original: btung ba zhim po la sogs pa'i btung ba rnams ni btung ba'o //
analyzed: btung ba zhim po la sogs pa'i btung ba rnams ni btung ba'o //
translated: Drinks are the various kinds of drinks, such as delicious drinks, and so on.

original: 'dod par bya ba yin pas na 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba yin pas na 'dod pa ste /
translated: They are objects of desire because they are desired.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de nyid ni goms shing 'dris par byed bas na yon tan no //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de nyid ni goms shing 'dris par byed bas na yon tan no //
translated: They are the objects of desire of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: 'dod pa yang yin la yon tan yang yin pas na 'dod pa'i yon tan yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa yang yin la yon tan yang yin pas na 'dod pa'i yon tan yin no //
translated: They are called “sense pleasures” because they are objects of desire and are also qualities.🔽The third aspect of the cause is mentioned in the verse beginning with “the mind that is not free from desire.”

original: nor rnams dang / bza' ba rnams dang / btung ba rnams dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams ni nor dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad de de rnams la chags pa ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: nor rnams dang / bza' ba rnams dang / btung ba rnams dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams ni nor dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad de de rnams la chags pa ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Wealth, food, drink, and sense pleasures are wealth, food, drink, and all sense pleasures. Attachment to them is strong desire.

original: dam tshig la ni dga' ba dang // zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis nga la brnyas par ma byed cig ces bya ba la sogs pa sdom pa yongs su bsrung bar mi nus pas de rnams la mi dga' zhing sdang ba'o //
analyzed: dam tshig la ni dga' ba dang // zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis nga la brnyas par ma byed cig ces bya ba la sogs pa sdom pa yongs su bsrung bar mi nus pas de rnams la mi dga' zhing sdang ba'o //
translated: Dislike of the commitments is not liking and being averse to them, thinking, You should not despise me and so on, because one is unable to keep the vows.

original: sngar spyad pa la sogs pa mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni lci ba dang / tshod ma dang / nas thug dang / slong mo rgyu zhing za ba la sogs pa sngar spyad pa bco brgyad byed par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: sngar spyad pa la sogs pa mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni lci ba dang / tshod ma dang / nas thug dang / slong mo rgyu zhing za ba la sogs pa sngar spyad pa bco brgyad byed par mi nus pa ste /
translated: Unable to perform the previously practiced and so on means unable to perform the eighteen previously practiced acts such as eating heavy, sour, barley soup, and going for alms.

original: de ltar de rnams dang / nor dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad la chags pa rnams ji ltar 'tshal ba bzhin du bgyid pa ni nges par srung ba med pa nyid du de la gnas pa de dag kyang dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa dang mthong ba gnyis kyis /
analyzed: de ltar de rnams dang / nor dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad la chags pa rnams ji ltar 'tshal ba bzhin du bgyid pa ni nges par srung ba med pa nyid du de la gnas pa de dag kyang dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa dang mthong ba gnyis kyis /
translated: Those who enter the maṇḍala and see it, even though they abide in that way,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bag chags bskyed pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bag chags bskyed pas /
translated: generate the latent tendencies of all tathāgatas.

original: dus gzhan du bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa dag kyang mchis so zhes bya'o /
analyzed: dus gzhan du bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa dag kyang mchis so zhes bya'o /
translated: In the future, all their wishes will be fulfilled.

original: @121a * // rgyu gsum pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: @121a * // rgyu gsum pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The third cause is stated:

original: lha gzhan gyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug gi zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: lha gzhan gyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug gi zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: “Those who enter the maṇḍala of another deity’s family…”

original: rgyu gang gis she na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis she na /
translated: By what cause?

original: gar dang / glu dang / gad mo dang / rtsed mo dang / kha zas dang / spyod pa la dga' ba rnams zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gar dang / glu dang / gad mo dang / rtsed mo dang / kha zas dang / spyod pa la dga' ba rnams zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Those who delight in dance, song, laughter, play, food, and conduct…”

original: 'dir rtsed mo ni gar gyi khyad par gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rtsed mo ni gar gyi khyad par gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: Here, play is a particular kind of dance.

original: don bzhi po 'di dag lha gzhan gyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor de rnams la /
analyzed: don bzhi po 'di dag lha gzhan gyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor de rnams la /
translated: These four topics are to be performed in the maṇḍalas of the other deities

original: gar la sogs pa'i cho ga'i tshul gyis bya ba yin par ston la /
analyzed: gar la sogs pa'i cho ga'i tshul gyis bya ba yin par ston la /
translated: through the method of the rites of dance and so on.

original: de bas na de dag la dga' ba rnams der 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de dag la dga' ba rnams der 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, those who delight in them will enter there.

original: de bzhin du gar la sogs pa zhugs pa rnams chos bdag med pa'i sbyor bas mi 'gal lo zhes rtogs par ma gyur pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du gar la sogs pa zhugs pa rnams chos bdag med pa'i sbyor bas mi 'gal lo zhes rtogs par ma gyur pas /
translated: Likewise, those who have entered dance and so on are not contradictory through the yoga of the reality of the absence of self in phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa'i chos nyid gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid can khong du ma chud pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa'i chos nyid gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid can khong du ma chud pas /
translated: Since they have not understood the reality of the Mahāyāna clear realization of all tathāgatas, which has the characteristic of nonduality,

original: lha gzhan gyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'dug ste /
analyzed: lha gzhan gyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'dug ste /
translated: they sit in the maṇḍala of the other deities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor sbangs nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor sbangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the maṇḍala of the family of all tathāgatas,

original: lha chen po la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gang yin pa de ni lha gzhan gyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: lha chen po la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gang yin pa de ni lha gzhan gyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: the maṇḍala of the worldly deities, such as Maheśvara, and so on, is the maṇḍala of the other deities.

original: lha gzhan gyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor de rnams su 'jug cing /
analyzed: lha gzhan gyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor de rnams su 'jug cing /
translated: They enter those maṇḍalas of other deities’ families,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor du bslab pa pa'i gzhis 'jigs shing skrag pas mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor du bslab pa pa'i gzhis 'jigs shing skrag pas mi 'jug go //
translated: but due to fear and terror, they do not enter the maṇḍala of the family of all tathāgatas.

original: ji lta bu der zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu der zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: re ba thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: re ba thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, “all hopes,” and so on.

original: re ba thams cad ni sred pa'i rnam pa thams cad de yongs su rdzogs pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don rnams grub pa ste /
analyzed: re ba thams cad ni sred pa'i rnam pa thams cad de yongs su rdzogs pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don rnams grub pa ste /
translated: All hopes are all types of craving. Their fulfillment is the accomplishment of desired goals.

original: de yang dag par bsdus par gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor yin no //
analyzed: de yang dag par bsdus par gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor yin no //
translated: That is fully included in the maṇḍala of the family of all tathāgatas.

original: de lta bur gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bla na med pa'i dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / rangs pa rnams 'byung bar byed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bla na med pa'i dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / rangs pa rnams 'byung bar byed pa yang yin no //
translated: Not only is it like that, it also produces unsurpassed joy, delight, and satisfaction.

original: de las gong na med pas na bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gong na med pas na bla na med pa yin no //
translated: It is unsurpassed because there is nothing higher than that.

original: sa dang po la sogs pa thob pas na skad cig ma dang po la skyes pa ni dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po la sogs pa thob pas na skad cig ma dang po la skyes pa ni dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one attains the first stage and so forth, the joy that arises in the first moment is called joy.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la skyes pa'i dga' ba de nyid ni mgu ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la skyes pa'i dga' ba de nyid ni mgu ba'o //
translated: The very same joy that arises in the second moment is delight.

original: de nyid kyi skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs par skyes pa ni rangs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs par skyes pa ni rangs pa ste /
translated: That very same joy that arises in the third moment and so forth is satisfaction,

original: yid bde ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽@121b de dag ni bla na med pa yang yin la dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / rangs pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: yid bde ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // @121b de dag ni bla na med pa yang yin la dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / rangs pa yang yin pas /
translated: which is to say, mental bliss.🔽Those are unsurpassed and are also joy, delight, and satisfaction.

original: bla na med pa'i dga' pa dang mgu ba dang rangs pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i dga' pa dang mgu ba dang rangs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are unsurpassed joy, delight, and satisfaction.

original: de rnams 'byung ba ni skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'byung ba ni skyed pa'o //
translated: The arising of those is their generation.

original: de byed pas na bla na med pa'i dga' ba dang mgu ba dang rangs pa rnams 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de byed pas na bla na med pa'i dga' ba dang mgu ba dang rangs pa rnams 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: Since he causes that, he causes the arising of unsurpassed joy, delight, and satisfaction.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor der ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor der ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The one who is like that is the one who is in the maṇḍala of the family of all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: All tathāgatas are the tathāgatas of the five families.

original: rigs ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rigs ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The families are the natures of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la rigs kyang yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la rigs kyang yin pas /
translated: Since they are all tathāgatas and also families,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs so //
translated: they are the families of all tathāgatas.

original: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Since they are the maṇḍala of those, they are the maṇḍala of the families of all tathāgatas.

original: der mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: der mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: One does not enter there.

original: ci'i phyir der mi 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir der mi 'jug ce na /
translated: Why does one not enter there?

original: bslab pa'i gzhis 'jigs shing skrag nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhis 'jigs shing skrag nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “frightened by the bases of training.”

original: bslab pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi lnga po dang / dge sbyong dang / dge slong ma la sogs pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi lnga po dang / dge sbyong dang / dge slong ma la sogs pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: Training is the five bases of training and the vows of a renunciant, a fully ordained monk, and so forth.

original: des 'jigs pa ni sdang ba ste /
analyzed: des 'jigs pa ni sdang ba ste /
translated: Frightened by that is aversion.

original: yongs su bsrung bar mi nus par gyur pas rnal 'byor gyis 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsrung bar mi nus par gyur pas rnal 'byor gyis 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Since one is unable to protect oneself, one is frightened by the yoga.

original: de ltar gyur pa de dag kyang ngan song gi dkyil 'khor gyi lam du 'jug par kha bltas shing gnas pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de dag kyang ngan song gi dkyil 'khor gyi lam du 'jug par kha bltas shing gnas pa rnams kyang /
translated: Those who have become like that, who are facing and abiding on the path of the sphere of the lower realms,

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir 'jug tu rang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir 'jug tu rang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: are fit to enter this great mandala of the vajra realm.

original: de la dmyal ba dang / yi dgas dang / dud 'gro ni ngan song sti /
analyzed: de la dmyal ba dang / yi dgas dang / dud 'gro ni ngan song sti /
translated: There, the lower realms are the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ni skye ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ni skye ba'i gnas so //
translated: Their sphere is the place of birth.

original: deng 'jug pa ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: deng 'jug pa ni skye ba'o //
translated: Entering there is birth.

original: de'i lam ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ste /
analyzed: de'i lam ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ste /
translated: The path to that is the path of the ten nonvirtues.

original: der mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas pa ni kha bltas shing gnas pa'o //
analyzed: der mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas pa ni kha bltas shing gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in that path of the ten nonvirtues is facing and abiding.

original: de lta bu de dag kyang rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen por 'jug tu rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu de dag kyang rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen por 'jug tu rung ngo //
translated: Those who are like that are fit to enter the great mandala of the vajra realm.

original: de la lha gzhan gyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor la ni mi dge ba bcu cho gar bya ba'i tshul gyis brten par 'chad la 'dir ni gang du yang bstan pa med do //
analyzed: de la lha gzhan gyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor la ni mi dge ba bcu cho gar bya ba'i tshul gyis brten par 'chad la 'dir ni gang du yang bstan pa med do //
translated: In the mandalas of other deities, the ten nonvirtues are explained as being relied upon in the manner of ritual performance, but here they are not taught anywhere.

original: de la de rnams rim gyis ldog pa'i byed par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de la de rnams rim gyis ldog pa'i byed par 'gyur bas /
translated: Since they are the agents of the gradual reversal of that,

original: rgyu de'i phyir 'jug pa'i cho ga 'dis kyang ldog par 'gyur du rung ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir 'jug pa'i cho ga 'dis kyang ldog par 'gyur du rung ba yin no //
translated: for that reason, it is suitable that they be reversed by this ritual of engagement.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa @122a * //🔽ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa rigs bdun dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa @122a * // ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa rigs bdun dang ldan pa /
translated: The Blessed One, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa la gnas pa'i skyes bu dam pa dag ston pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa la gnas pa'i skyes bu dam pa dag ston pa yin te /
translated: is the teacher of the holy beings who abide in the bodhisattva vow, endowed with the seven types of vows of ethical discipline.

original: chos la spyod pas na chos can te /
analyzed: chos la spyod pas na chos can te /
translated: Since they practice the Dharma, they are those with Dharma,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning the practice of the ten perfections, the ten bodhisattva levels, and the level of buddhahood.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The ethical discipline of all the tathāgatas is the ethical discipline of restraint, the ethical discipline of gathering virtuous dharmas, and the ethical discipline of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o //
translated: The meditative absorption of all the transcendent ones is the nine serial steps of meditative equipoise.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom of all the transcendent ones is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab nyid ni dngos grub dam pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab nyid ni dngos grub dam pa'i thabs te /
translated: The ethics, meditative absorption, and wisdom of all the transcendent ones are the means for the highest spiritual attainment.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub pa'i thabs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub pa'i thabs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: They are the special means for accomplishing perfect buddhahood.

original: de lta bu'i thabs de dag gis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i thabs de dag gis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: By means of such means, one will attain buddhahood in three incalculable aeons.

original: de bas na de rnams sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub tshol zhing mngon par 'dod pas na /
analyzed: de bas na de rnams sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub tshol zhing mngon par 'dod pas na /
translated: Therefore, since they seek and aspire to the enlightenment of the buddhas,

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar ba la sogs pa dang / sa rnams kyis 'bad pa'i nyon mongs pa dag kyang chos nyid de zhes pa la /
